alert.note: Alert for Bastrop; Caldwell; Fayette; Gonzales; Lavaca; Lee (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 24 at 4:42AM CST until January 24 at 7:00AM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CST THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHEASTERN BASTROP, SOUTHEASTERN CALDWELL, FAYETTE, GONZALES, NORTHWESTERN LAVACA AND SOUTHEASTERN LEE COUNTIES... At 442 AM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 5 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Gonzales, La Grange, Smithville, Schulenburg, Shiner, Flatonia, Moulton, Nixon, Waelder, Smiley, Fayetteville, Round Top, Cistern, Muldoon, Palmeto State Park, Carmine, Newtonville, Elm Grove, Colony and Nickle. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Bastrop; Caldwell; Fayette; Gonzales; Lavaca; Lee
